channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: China harboring military-linked fugitive scientist at San Francisco consulate, FBI says
CNN analyst: President Trump's motives are 'highly suspect'
item.description: CNN's Rosemary Church speaks with CNN Global Affairs Analyst Max Boot who says President Donald Trump is "demonizing" China for domestic political gain rather than as part of a comprehensive strategy.

item.title: Portland mayor tear gassed after speaking with protesters on presence of federal agents
Birx warns of concerning rise in cases in 12 cities as Trump paints a rosy picture
Trump asked why there are no medical experts at briefing. Hear his response
item.description: During a coronavirus news conference, CNN's Kaitlan Collins asks President Donald Trump why he appeared alone without public health experts at his side.

item.title: Covid-19 could be second leading cause of death in Los Angeles
All charges dropped against Red Bull heir accused in death of police officer, Thai Police say
item.description: Charges have been dropped against the heir to the Red Bull energy drink empire, Vorayud Yoovidhya, related to the death of a Thai policeman in 2012, Thai police say.

item.title: Former Nazi camp guard convicted of 5,230 counts of accessory to murder
item.description: A former Nazi concentration camp guard was convicted of thousands of counts of being an accessory to murder and given a two-year suspended prison sentence Thursday, a court announced.

item.title: Trump joins Republicans who are criticizing Liz Cheney
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday joined Republicans who are publicly criticizing GOP Rep. Liz Cheney, who has broken with the President in regard to American military engagement overseas and support for Dr. Anthony Fauci during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: China's 'dark' fishing fleet may be the reason 'ghost ships' washed up in Japan: NGO
item.description: The dead just kept coming in 2017.

item.title: Fox News parts ways with a morning host who caused a Covid-19 scare
item.description: Fox News has parted ways with a host who dismayed fellow staffers when she came to work while visibly sick in the early days of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: That cognitive test doesn't mean what Trump thinks it means
item.description: On Wednesday night, President Donald Trump did an interview with Fox News medical correspondent Marc Siegel in which the subject turned to his mental fitness for the job. Which is when Trump said, well, all of this (and, yes, you need to read every word):

item.title: Why this country has so many coronavirus skeptics
item.description: Not only do some Mexicans not believe in the severity of Covid-19, they don't believe it exists at all. This comes as the country sees hundreds of thousands of confirmed coronavirus cases and at least 40,000 deaths. CNN's Matt Rivers speaks with sociologists and people on the street about why so many Mexicans are skeptical of the virus.

item.title: Trump claims not to be following Maxwell case despite long ties to Epstein
item.description: Camera footage unearthed by NBC News last year from a party at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate in 1992 captures Trump greeting party guests, dancing with young women and, in some clips, speaking into the ear of Jeffrey Epstein, a casually dressed financier with folded shirt sleeves, who is chummily laughing at whatever the party host is telling him.

item.title: Wrapped in trash bags, he prayed for help before he died
item.description: Less than a month before he died of Covid-19, Victor Sison posted photos of himself at the New Jersey nursing home where he had worked for many years.

item.title: A Netflix dating show has sparked major debate about colorism
item.description: On Netflix's "Indian Matchmaking," marriage consultant Sima Taparia travels the world to meet with hopeful clients and help them find the perfect match for an arranged marriage.

item.title: Donald Trump and Woody Johnson act as if the rules don't apply to them
item.description: On Tuesday the public got yet another example of President Donald Trump's remarkable ability, and willingness, to exploit opportunities for personal gain.

item.title: Restauranteurs serve Netanyahu a 'final meal' as chaos mounts over Israel's coronavirus restrictions
item.description: The pressure on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is building as quickly as the protests, with his official residence on Balfour Street now the focal point of protests that are growing in frequency and in size.

item.title: CNN's Don Lemon: This White House really has some nerve
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon gives his take on the White House's response to former Vice President Joe Biden after he said Donald Trump was the first racist to win the presidency.

item.title: Boko Haram militants kill five hostages kidnapped in Nigeria's northeast, UN says
item.description: Boko Haram militants have killed five hostages, including four aid workers, who were abducted last month in northeastern Nigeria, a UN spokeswoman told CNN on Thursday.

item.title: These young medics are fighting Covid-19 misinformation in 30 languages
item.description: Determined to protect minority communities from Covid-19 misinformation, a group of young doctors set about offering health information in over 30 languages.

item.title: Let's talk about Kanye West's damaging and inaccurate claims about Harriet Tubman
item.description: Kanye West's campaign rally in South Carolina on Sunday drew our attention with his appalling misinterpretation of Harriet Tubman's legacy when he said Tubman "never actually freed the slaves." Although his comments received much backlash, followed by an intense tweetstorm about his personal life and family, it was too easy for people to dismiss the comments as just a trivial viral sensation.

item.title: Taiwan's parliament approves proposal to rename China Airlines
item.description: Renaming a company is always going to be a complicated undertaking, but rarely does it hit the levels of controversy currently swirling around China Airlines, Taiwan's largest air carrier.

item.title: Mike Pompeo is botching his job
item.description: Just when you thought Mike Pompeo's reputation couldn't sink any lower, along comes the blatantly ideological and highly politicized report of his Commission on Unalienable Rights.

item.title: Nine-year-old-girl is the youngest to die from coronavirus in Florida, state health officials say
item.description: A 9-year-old girl from Putnam County is the youngest person to have died in Florida from coronavirus complications, according to the state department of health.

item.title: Ancient Roman artifacts discovered by police in Spanish seafood store
item.description: Authorities inspecting a seafood store in Spain have discovered a collection of ancient Roman containers, called amphorae, some of which could have been created in the first century and recovered from shipwrecks off the Mediterranean coast.

item.title: Fact-checking Trump's 'impressive numbers' claim
item.description: CNN's Kate Bolduan analyzes President Donald Trump's recent White House press briefings saying the "rosy picture" he is painting doesn't align with recent coronavirus numbers.

item.title: Hurricane Douglas rapidly intensified into a major hurricane as it moves toward Hawaii
item.description: Douglas has rapidly intensified into a Category 3 hurricane on Thursday with wind speeds of 120 mph.

item.title: Gymnastics Australia promises action after multiple former athletes allege mental and physical abuse
item.description: Australia's gymnastics federation has promised to take action after multiple former gymnasts allege they were subject to emotional and physical abuse during their careers.

item.title: TikTok could be sold to American investors to avert US ban, reports say
item.description: Could an American takeover of TikTok save it from being locked out of the United States?

item.title: Biden and Trump's cognitive health are in the spotlight
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta examines how the cognitive health of both President Donald Trump and presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden are playing out as a potential campaign issue in the race for the White House.

item.title: Woman invites governor to funeral after mom's Covid-19 death
item.description: A woman whose mother died of Covid-19 says Texas Gov. Greg Abbott is invited to the funeral, calling out the government's inaction.

item.title: Taylor Swift will drop a surprise new album tonight
item.description: Surprise! Taylor Swift is releasing a new album this week, one she wrote and recorded entirely in isolation.

item.title: This one letter in a textbook could change how millions of kids learn about race
item.description: Albert Broussard's intention to capitalize one letter in one word may impact millions of children around the US and how they learn about race.

item.title: Two tourist vessels, two completely different ways of managing the pandemic
item.description: The Canada/United States border is expected to remain closed until at least August 21, but there's one region where American and Canadian tourists can still pass almost side by side, and that's Niagara Falls.

item.title: How mosquitoes evolved to be attracted to humans, and what that means for the future
item.description: Not all mosquitoes are created equal, even if it feels that way when they bite you.

item.title: Ultraviolet flash detected by astronomers after 'peculiar' white dwarf supernova
item.description: Astronomers witnessed a flash of ultraviolet light after a white dwarf star exploded in a supernova, according to a new study.

item.title: All-female round the world voyage hunts for pollution hotspots
item.description: Eight hundred miles from land in the Pacific Ocean, Emily Penn had a revelation. It was the late 2000s and she was working aboard the boat Earthrace as it circumnavigated the globe. Jumping overboard for a wash, she saw a toothbrush floating by. Then a cigarette lighter. Then a bottle top. Then hundreds of plastic fragments came into view. "It just didn't make any sense," she recalls.

item.title: A red panda is missing from her habitat at an Ohio zoo, but she's not a threat to anyone
item.description: There may be a red panda hiding up in a tree somewhere in Columbus, Ohio.

item.title: Nick Cannon is learning the hard way that cancel culture is real
item.description: Nick Cannon found out the hard way that freedom of speech does not mean freedom from consequences.

item.title: Republican lawmaker slams Trump's remark: 'Unacceptably obtuse'
item.description: After President Donald Trump sent well wishes to former Jeffrey Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell, who faces charges for recruiting, grooming and ultimately sexually abusing minors as young as 14 as Epstein's alleged accomplice, a former business partner of Epstein's says Trump and Maxwell "knew each other well." CNN's Pamela Brown reports.

item.title: Is Harvard worth $50,000 if it's only online? That depends on who you ask
item.description: Lucy Tu is well acquainted with online classes and virtual events. She finished her senior year of high school online, wrapped up as editor of the school's newspaper over group chats and video calls, competed in a national speech tournament through a video submission and even had a small graduation party on Zoom.

item.title: This couple captured an extremely rare event in their engagement photo
item.description: A New York couple got engaged under a comet and captured the moment in a spectacular picture.

item.title: Tensions between the US and China have continued to ratchet up following the forced closure by Washington of Beijing's consulate in Houston
Chinese official: US is 'breaking down the friendship bridge'
item.description: Beijing has promised to retaliate to the Houston closure, with state media pointing to the potential shuttering of one of the US' numerous diplomatic missions within China. CNN's David Culver reports.

item.title: US move to shut China's Houston consulate draws questions about motives
item.description: • Video appears to show paper-burning at Chinese consulate after US orders it to close • US defense chief pushes allies to challenge 'bullying' China

item.title: Esper in crisis management mode amid turmoil of Trump's reelection campaign
item.description: On Thursday, Mark Esper will have served exactly one year as secretary of defense but the last few months have been the toughest of his tenure as tensions with the White House have spilled out in public.

item.title: Trump puts self-preservation above the pandemic
item.description: • Latest on coronavirus: Birx and Fauci express concern as Trump paints a rosy picture • ANALYSIS: That cognitive test doesn't mean what Donald Trump thinks it means • Trump asked why there are no medical experts at briefing. Hear his response

item.title: Portland mayor tear gassed after speaking with protesters on presence of federal agents
item.description: • ANALYSIS: US presidents generally don't try to invade their own country

item.title: CNN anchor fact-checks congressman: 'You think everything is fine?'
item.description: CNN's Briana Keilar presses Texas Rep. Chip Roy on the federal coronavirus response after Roy said he wants a second opinion to Dr. Anthony Fauci's and the White House coronavirus task force.
